bow: how many csections have you had yesterday for my 31 week dr appointment my dr asked if we planned on having another baby after this one said we definitely are going to try for third baby possibly but that little too far ahead right now she said the risk after cesareans that my uterus could attach to my scar tissue or other problems goes way up my first son was csection because my labor was progressing and his heart rate was dropping he was gon na come out at 9lb 4oz so with this next boy we are having scheduled one husband can take off work no overdue 10 days like the first time it fine with me cuz apparently it hard to find dr that will go along with vbac anyways ve looked into how many you can safely have of course everyone is different healed well and pretty quickly too only 28 and try my best to exercise and eat healthy do have diastasis recti and endometriosis so just want to hear from some of you other moms if you ve had csection how many or if you ve had vbac too share your stories if you like ve only had one section and 34 weeks now with my 2nd and going for vbac this time so not sure my experience is too relevant to your question but had vbac consult with the hospital this week and when the doctor asked me if planning on having more kids after this one and said it possibility she said vbac was my best option if that the case for the reasons that you mention above definitely not trying to talk you into vbac if that not what you re into but in case you re on the fence apparently it does make future pregnancies less complicated my hospital was way more supportive of the vbac route than anticipated went in there with all kinds of stats etc to talk them into it and did end up needing them so if you look around you may find practice that supports it hope that helps my first was an emergency section my second an unmedicated vbac because with an epidural would be able to feel if my uterus scar burst open or something else went wrong had horrible back labor and begged for section but had my son before my blood work came back from the lab while prepping for the section never got the doctor told me if wanted the section could obviously get it but third child would have to be born via section again no chance of vbac wich also means no more children after that because three section are the maximum this was in germany have you looked into vbac placenta accreta becomes an increased risk factor to consider with multiple cesareans if you can find care provider near you that does supports vbacs they re more likely to be honest about the risks for multiple cesareans over care provider who is against them there are risks either way but feel like that something that you should be able to decide with 100 certainty you need to know everything about both ways in order to do that myself have never had csection just big believer in fully informed decisions when it comes to birth doctors like to scare us into things instead of talking with us honestly midwife birth center is more likely to perform vbacs if that an option near you removed ve heard of many successful vba2c confused is it not allowed there to try for vba2c ve thought about having vbac but more set on having the csection wondering if it possible to go through regular birth after csections think gon na look into that also with our insurance we re going to have to switch drs and hospitals with our third so may just find myself midwife very helpful thank you for sharing ve heard of many successful vba2c so know it possible look up birth without fear and improving birth if you have facebook this is anecdotal but my mother has had she was at risk for the placenta growing into the scar with but everything turned out fine if there were any complications they would have had to just do hysterectomy think was born little bit early currently weeks and the uterus was at very high risk or rupture like cell thick when they finally went in there not sure if that related to the sections or having kids for 22 years think sections would be fine my doctor does even offer vbacs so we re going for probably the last section again had an emergency section after being induced at 41+1 baby was 9lbs 11oz his head never descended so it was inevitable trying for vbac this time but it will likely end up section basically if do go into labor naturally or this babe also measuring large or if labor did progress without labor enhancing drugs it has been decided it will be another section here ottawa canada have been told is generally the limit each time had increased risks after sections the 3rd pregnancy will be section mean they could stop you from having but it would be recommended if you go the midwife way the third route please make sure you are near hospital after having two sections you are at much higher risk of complications will do thank you thank you not going to worry myself about everything now im close to the end im just bit annoyed that they went along with me wanting to have csection for this one then they go and tell me all these issues could run into and they do even suggest vbac to begin with 1st was section for failed induction had vbac first 18 hours in medicated then epidural with my second years later although had to have few extra ultrasounds to make sure that the placenta was not attached near my scars or previa before they would let me go for the vbac both were lbs 6oz had scheduled section due to breech then vbac with an epidural my ob is very pro vbac and has done vba2c and even does vaginal breech deliveries sometimes which is somewhat rare here in the us the funny thing is that picked him specifically for these reasons and then he happened to be unavailable when went into labor with and my vbac was done by doctor never met before who was not particularly pro vbac at all my first was vaginal pretty much textbook no complications not even any tearing no episiotomy was prepared for the nosedive my future pregnancies would take second was section at 33 weeks and the only reason it was 31 weeks is because my water did break all the way just trickle like your first wound up with section because labour was progressing though my contractions were only few minutes part and incredibly painful was stuck at cm dilation and her heart rate kept decelerating for my third had vbac begged for section because we discovered that our baby had passed away right at the end of the pregnancy and did think would be able to handle vaginal delivery knowing what was on the other end of it for us and they would ve done one for me if insisted but the doctor told me could handle vbac and it was worth doing it to avoid having second section realized she was right and it went fine was induced had an epidural and physically it was the easiest labour ever had very grateful to that doctor for encouraging me to try do regret that choice at all know it your choice but if you can find doctor willing to help you through vbac you actually have pretty good chance of being able to do it women with sections now have much higher likelihood of having vaginal delivery because the incision is made far lower on the uterine wall and that lowers the risks that used to be associated with sections it much safer than it used to be that being said live in canada and know things are different here have heard of many doctors who are unwilling to help woman have vbac so take this with grain of salt was told the same also in canada that is the comfortable limit by obs but is usually ok after that it not recommended just had my 3rd 1=emergency section 2=attempted vbac no progression he ended up having huge head 3=automatic scheduled section and this is planned to be our last everything went fine with all of them and this time around actually had the easiest recovery and the dr said only had minimal scar tissue from last time ve heard though that it really depends on the condition of your uterus each time some people can have many sections with no issue some people uterus will thin out and be at high risk of rupture some people with have scar tissue and high risk of placenta accreta lot depends on what they find in there and then will give you advice for the next one gt ve thought about having vbac but more set on having the csection wondering if it possible to go through regular birth after csections if you ca find doctor who will help you have vaginal birth after just one section you may have hard time finding anyone to help you after sections she was right that midwife or birth center is more likely to perform vbac than doctor midwife would definitely be the best route for me if we re able to have third child it not too late to change doctors if you are feeling great about them then find someone who will support bac if that what you want to do my sister had csections first was emergency second was breach and third was scheduled though her doc would have done vba2c my sister found the recovery more difficult for the third she really fit too there are risks no matter what and whatever you feel is best for you should be supported as long as you have all the medical facts for you and your baby also just as positive side note it is totally possible to have big baby vaginally my lo was 10 lbs and we had wonderful unmedicated vaginal birth feel like we hear lot of horror stories about birth so just wanted to put out positive story that it can be peaceful amazing and just magical thank goodness for modern medicine when things do go as planned of course every pregnancy and birth is different so if vaginal birth did work out the first time it still could with the second or third good luck with whatever you decide to do as long as you and baby are healthy and happy that all that matters midwife probably wo take vba2c because of the risks for rupture they are able to operate if anything goes wrong you could look for practice that has obs and midwives they might be more supportive of vba2c vba2c is still pretty rare in the us though vbacs are much more common my sister who is an amp nurse opted for third csection she said it seemed less risky to her than vba2c even though her doc would have done vba2c she had hoped for vbac with her second but she was breach my hospital is specifically equipped to do vbacs not something need thankfully but lot of hospitals seem to be more in favor of this option they have delivery room attached to surgical room incase section is needed thought it was pretty cool during my tour last pregnancy anyway if it something you are considering definitely think it worth looking into an office hospital that will accommodate you my step mom had and her youngest is 28 all were high risk pregnancies and the latest she carried was 32 or maybe 34 weeks do know if that makes your situation more or less favorable than hers but there it is ve had two sections and pregnant again now with planned section when had my first the doctor mentioned that there was limit but it was per uterus he said my uterus was good to have second child but if had second child to ask the doctor doing the surgery to check the thickness of my uterus when they opened it back up to see if it could withstand another pregnancy and section when they opened me up for the second time they said had lot of scar tissue but that they removed lot of it and could handle another pregnancy and section so we went for it this is it for us as we only want but sure could ask again if we wanted to try for 4th to see what the condition is if you go the section route it might be worth asking the operating doctor before hand to check the condition for another pregnancy 41 weeks 10 6lb baby meconium aspiration syndrome amp pphn 18 hours labor emergency cesarean birth 39 weeks 8lb baby polyhydramnios scheduled cesarean birth my doctor said could try vbac if it was what wanted did but for my own mental health went with repeat cesarean coupled with the complications of that pregnancy was fine with my choice but we were done at no interest in anymore for lots of reasons ve had sections first was emergency after baby got stuck after pushing for hours second we were going to try vbac if went into labour before baby got to certain size ended up in section for my third really wanted to try vbac and my ob said there was chance of uterine rupture my husband was not comfortable taking the chance so we had another section had my tubes tied in that section so there was no discussion of further pregnancies do have friend who had sections with no complications had fantastic section first baby was breech second baby was excited to do vbac that was incredible can appreciate the challenge that is vaginal delivery honestly do know why anyone would have an elective section major abdominal surgery because it more convenient no thanks do do what best for you do what best for your baby had wonderful vbac years ago each pregnancy labor and delivery were totally different you can do it unmedicated wtf think that unusual had an epidural for my vbac when was 3cm praise da lawd it was incredible live in missouri ve had sections and amp cs during my last section had my ob carefully examine my uterus for scar tissue and she said it looked amazing and should have any issues having more children ve met several women who have had sections and heard about few that have had although if had been more informed would have tried for vbac with my second with uterine rupture can be significant amount of pain different and intense from labor pains and epidural numbs this just like contractions some places only allow vbacs without epidural so they can catch the signs of uterine rupture before it completely bursts putting both mom and baby lives in imminent danger this restriction is as common in the us edited to add there are many indicators of uterine rupture not just pain but each rupture can be completely different from the next have seen three ruptures in my career vbacs and one primip and each presented differently it scary crazy thing to happen but providers should be trained to monitor for these signs and pay extra special attention them when presented guess they could stop you like someone else mentioned but it is strongly discouraged of course yes they told me from the start no epidural for me but they promised me some med cocktail iv that would help lot never got that either it was awful was begging for help the whole time removed ve had the first one after failed induction on friday the second after failed induction on friday the third was planned because she was growing enough on tuesday day before christmas could choose the following friday but just wanted to get it over with by then each recovery was different my last was the easiest though just had my third section two weeks ago it was planned like the first two but went into labor early and when arrived at the hospital they asked if wanted to try for vaginal birth opted for the section as was the plan and while she did it my surgeon checked out my uterus and said it looks great and should have no issues going for fourth if want which do but it nice to know that everything looks good think it very individual just remember that medical professionals have to give you the worst case scenario so that you re informed ummmm on my second pregnancy in ottawa and was given the same info advice guess it consistent my son was section after failed induction at 10 days overdue the dr basically reached his hand right up felt my son head and my pelvic bones and told me it was happening my son heart rate was also decelerating irregular so just wanted him out he was only 8lbs 13 oz but to this day has an enormous head his head is bigger than most year old kids and he not quite originally my ob was happy to let me go to term to see if baby would come on their own but ve recently been diagnosed with placenta praevia if that does resolve will have to have repeat section my mil had in the 1980 know they never wanted 4th kid apparently her first section my husband was rushed emergency and they had to make the incision vertically instead of horizontally and she was told from the get go she would have to have repeat sections she had her 2nd one year and 10 days later an obstetric healthcare provider and have client at the moment who is having her 8th cesarean section obviously that higher risk scenario but with proper prenatal care you can decrease the risks associated as for the vbac conversation very pro vbac as long as the client understands the associated risks the recommendation is to deliver in hospital setting so that electronic fetal monitoring is available to continuously listen to the baby heart rate it is actually severe pain that is seen first with uterine rupture but change in the fetal heart rate that could be an significant prolonged increase in the rate or significant deceleration pain is confounding factor but is not always present and does not always appear in the expected manner it important that you re at hospital with section capability within maximum of 30 mins preferably sooner you should be getting ultrasounds during the pregnancy to make sure your placenta has not attached to the scar tissue inside your uterus making an accreta that would need to be surgically removed vbac is not an option for clients who have had incision or vertical incision because of the high rate of rupture having v2bac or more obviously increases your risk of uterine rupture but there is great research on how much it increases the risk in general population the success rate of vbac is approximately 80 so it actually quite high but to decrease risk to the baby all of the other guidelines should be followed so if you re planning on potentially having vaginal birth at some point the logical time to do that would be now as it decreases risk for all future pregnancies rather than attempting after cesarean sections nice to see someone else from ottawa here my first was at the general and had wonderful care this time am going to the civic hoping the section with would most definitely not be given the option my dr said we re currently trying for baby number after my first section she said that was the limit for most reputable ob practices in our state they ca stop you true but doctors are allowed to turn you away so to speak so you would have difficult time finding doctor but obviously someone will do it because it has to be done think insurances stop covering the procedure as well there is really great facebook group for fact based vbac information lots of women on there are looking at csections give it few days to wade through some of the dumber irrelevant posts but ve learned lot the name of the group is vbac and birth after cesarean facts evidence based support fyi pain is not the best indicator for uterine rupture http bp blogspot com vxzf ontffa vzvvj08czhi aaaaaaaaya8 fy8ixodh4 s1600 ur 2bsigns 2b640 jpg no pain is not good indicator of uterine rupture there are many indicators of uterine rupture crappy fhts unexpected ascent of the fetal presenting part tachysystole of contractions vaginal bleeding there can be all of these things there can be one each mom is different is the rupture slight tear over the incision only an inch long did the uterus grossly rupture and the baby is now inside of the abdominal cavity these moms will experience different symptoms the first maybe just sudden stabbing pain over the incisional line and the contractions looking bit funny on the monitor but baby could deliver and the rupture may be discovered afterwards when it is atonous the second that mom and baby could go into shock and die in mere seconds pain may not be *the* indicator of rupture but will sure as hell rule it out when laboring pushing with vbac and she starts having sudden pain characteristic intensity changes ve had sections my last section months ago was section hysterectomy with an extra hours of surgery to separate my placenta from my bladder had placenta percreta with bladder invasion sweet thank you thanks so much the biggest reason want to go for csection this time too is the unmedicated part got an epidural when was centimeters only made it to things were progressing and even with the epidural still felt tremendous pressure not sure could handle it without it was at the queensway last time and doing it again the nurses were awesome and it close to home so bonus have had sections the first two tried vaginally and both ended with sections after 24+ hours of labor for each the scheduled sections were 100 times easier to recover from not saying sections are easy to recover from at all though was advised to seriously consider not having anymore children because of the upped risks with the amount have had the 4th section took the longest because there was already so much scar tissue they had to go through had my first section at 20 and my last section at 34 my sister has had sections she was told not to have more kids because they all come out huge and she has to have section no matter what she did have any complications with them but sure is ridiculous number for doctors to deal with in terms of scar tissue and such had one section one vbac had placenta previa scare with the second pregnancy so because of that did lots of reading about the risks of uterine scars ve never heard of blanket prohibition against getting pregnant after sections just prohibition against labour vaginal birth but reading this thread it is apparently common in my country when they operate on particularly scarry sticky uterus they just tell the woman afterwards that she should have anymore children you are absolutely right that everybody is different why make sweeping statements based on averages when you have the chance to look at the relevant uterus directly their is no magic cutoff number the risks simply go up for each additional section and sadly lot of those risks apply to the entire pregnancy and not just to the optional vbac part of it do think the doctor was trying to discourage you from having lots of children rather think the doctor was trying to get you to seriously consider vbac have you straight up asked if they would go along with it or if this doctor knows doctor who will go along with it some doctors will even do inductions if the main reason for the prior section was the baby size even if you plan section do forget to discuss what happens if you go into labour spontaneously before that stopping an spontaneous early term labour to have section would be such shame no epidural allowed with my vbac the anesthesist tried to counsel me on something like that but the midwife and nurse were all this guy does know what he is talking about if we have to wait for you to feel your scar bursting we would be seriously incompetent with the ctg am 39 and have had sections with my third this past year being the easiest asked my doctor about 4th because we re undecided on more children high risk would be something that we factor into that decision my ob is high risk doctor and she told me that was good candidate for 4th section and that with the change in the way that they close the incision the risks had gone way down but that was my doctor speaking with me about my own physical health and situation would definitely recommend having this discussion with your ob have had sections first was an induction at 42 weeks that did progress after 30 hours of labor tried for vbac for the second but there was no progress at 41 weeks and we could induce safely second time due to the previous section number and were scheduled sections because of my history we were very open with our obgyn about our desire to have children and he let me know after surgery and examining my uterus that my scarring from the sections was minimal and that my uterus was not thinning or wearing due to the incisions he felt with each pregnancy another section would be safe if he had told us it would not have been safe we would not have had another child good luck
